title: ECB cuts interest rates and announces new stimulus scheme -- as it happened | Business | The Guardian
summary: european markets hit 6.5-year high after ecb action .
imf backs ecb over today 's measures .
bp shares fall 5 % after court ruling .
draghi : ecb discussed qe . some council members wanted more action .
draghi : today 's decisions were not unanimous .
draghi : ecb has agreed to buy asset-backed securities .

documents.title: closing summary
text: ok , that 's all for today .
we 'll have an updated news story on today 's developments online shortly .

the post-press conference summary ( at 3.12 pm ) explains the main measures announced by the european central bank ; interest rate cuts to fresh record lows , and a new programme to stimulate the eurozone economy by buying bundles of debt ( including loans to firms , and home mortgages ) .

the international monetary fund has backed the plan , with christine lagarde saying : we strongly welcome the measures taken by the ecb , which will help to counteract the dangers posed by an extended period of low inflation . ''
perhaps a touch of 'i told you so ' , given the imf has repeatedly called for more action from the ecb ?
simon nixon ( @ simon nixon ) gloating lagarde statement is clear attempt by imf to take credit for ecb action .
will fuel sus of french/italian/us leftist putsch .
european stock markets have hit their highest levels since january 2008 , as investors welcome the latest easing of monetary policy .
and the euro has weakened dramatically against the us dollar , down over two cents at one stage to $ 1.2935 .
many analysts have predicted that today 's moves mean the ecb is now unlikely to launch quantitative easing soon .
brenda kelly of ig explains : the governing council agreed to use all unconventional measures at its disposal to hit its mandate - stable inflation at 2 % .

while this might suggest that a quantitative easing programme is still possible , the decline in the euro and the diverging policies of western central banks would indicate extraordinary stimulus of this nature will be kicked into the long grass for now . ''
rolling reaction starts here .

and the institute of directors has echoed mario draghi 's call for more structural reform in the euro area , saying : the eurozone economies face a number of significant challenges , from insufficient flexibility in their labour markets to heavy-handed regulations stifling entrepreneurialism .
long-term liberalisation is the key to putting the eurozone back on the path to stability and growth , not short term monetary policy tools . ''
back tomorrow , when we get the latest us jobs data ( yup , it 's non-farm payroll friday ) .
goodnight , and thanks .
gw

frederik ducrozet of credit agricole 's analyst note on the ecb is well worth a read ; it includes this handy summary of the key points : the ecb unexpectedly cut all policy rates today , bringing the refi rate down to 0.05 % and the deposit rate to -0.20 % .
the tltros will therefore be conducted at 0.15 % .
this time the ecb reached the lower bound as draghi promised there would be no more rate cuts .

the other announcements ( an abs and covered bonds purchases programme , with operational details coming in october ) and changes to the official statement and staff forecasts were broadly in line with our expectations .
crucially , draghi explicitly hinted at an increase in the ecb 's balance sheet of roughly €1,000bn to bring it back to the 2012 highs ( €3,100bn ) .
the idea would be to get there using both net liquidity injections from tltros and outright asset purchases ( circa €500bn each ) , although it could take longer than expected .
we see the latest easing measures as very positive for the medium- term macro outlook , hence we continue to rule out sovereign qe .
still , the burden of proof will remain on upcoming macro and inflation data .
frederik ducrozet ( @ fwred ) my ecb reaction piece - targeting a €1 trillion boost to the ecb 's balance sheet ?
christian schulz , senior economist at berenberg bank , is concerned that the ecb did n't give more detail about its plans for an asset-backed securities programme .
that suggest serious dissent among the governing council , he says : the ecb has stepped up to the plate , again , as the eurozone recovery almost grinds to a halt .
the confidence shock of russia 's aggression against ukraine and reform delays in france and italy are threatening the projected gradual rebound of inflation towards target .
after easing policy significantly - and with quantifiable effect - in june , the ecb today announced more measures .

but , amid apparent serious disagreements , the ecb was unable to provide details of the scale of its asset purchase programmes , and may have added modest rate cuts to underline its intent to do more to support the recovery

documents.title: monex europe : draghi 's `` ay caramba moment '' on growth
text: mario draghi , president of the european central bank ( ecb ) , arriving for today 's news conference in frankfurt .
pfaffenbach/reuters if you 're just joining us ( where were you ? !
) , i 've been mopping up reaction to today 's surprising moves from the european central bank , from 3.33pm .
here 's some more , from eimear daly , head of market analysis at monex europe .
she sums up today 's news , and also predicts that qe is now on the back-burner for a while at least .
draghi shy to implement qe emergency kit ecb 's draghi certainly was n't bluffing at his surprise appearance at jackson hole .

the de-anchoring of inflation expectations obviously gravely unsettled the central banker and with it came draghi 's ay caramba moment , a realisation that growth is actually needed to generate inflation .

in his late august speech , draghi set out his new pro-growth doctrine and while he maintains his iron-cast belief that structural reforms must be taken to shake-up europe 's rigid and over-encumbered economies , he recognised that fiscal and monetary policy equally have their part to play .
at today 's press conference , draghi put his thesis into action , announcing an across the board cut to interest rates and an asset-backed securities programme to give demand a much needed push . ''
the 10 basis points that were shaved off all headline rates were purely symbolic .
the cut highlights the point that the ecb is in an easing cycle , while the rest of the developed economies ready themselves for higher rates .
the cut did its job , sending the euro sharply lower and thus instantly addressing a source of the eurozone 's deflationary pressure . ''

draghi 's announcement of new asset-backed securities purchase programmes , aiming to finally get credit to the eurozone starved corporates , meant he has recognised that the eurozone 's zombie banking sector is failing to support economic growth .
in effect , the ecb is now going over the banking sector 's heads .
while no face value of purchases was given , this factor is almost immaterial .

the fact that the world 's second biggest central bank is now actively investing in this market will drive global investors into these assets and the ecb 's seal of approval is worth more than any target amount of purchases . ''
ecb qe is the last remaining tool in the bank 's arsenal and draghi admitted that some members wanted to do more than today 's measures .

after surviving a sovereign debt crisis and a severe recession , draghi does not want to cave in to doing qe now and it will remain locked in the bank 's emergency kit while their other measures attempt to resuscitate eurozone inflation .
in effect , these measures may be more effective than buying government debt ever would be and thus the qe kit will continue to gather dust . ''

documents.title: euro hits new 14-month low
text: the euro has continued to lose value against the us dollar as traders take stock of the ecb 's decisions .
it 's now down more than two cents , or 1.6 % , at $ 1.2935 .
that 's a new 14-month low , and i imagine mario draghi will be rather pleased to see it .
a weaker euro will help push up inflation , and give manufacturers a boost .
as this chart shows , the euro tumbled after the ecb cut interest rates at 12.45pm bst , and then continued to weaken as the asset-backed securities plan was announced .
euro vs dollar today .
reuters
jamie mcgeever ( @ reutersjamie ) clear sign of just how bad things are in euro zone if 7 yrs after credit crunch and 6 yrs after lehman the ecb is doing what it 's doing now

documents.title: european markets hit 6.5-year high after ecb action
text: european stock markets have just closed at their highest level since the early days of the financial crisis .
the ftseurofirst 300 index , which tracks the biggest companies across the region , has risen by 1.2 % today to its highest close since january 2008 .
that was the month before northern rock was nationalised , and eight months before lehman brothers failed .

italy 's ftse mib surged by 2.9 % , followed by spain 's ibex ( +2 % ) as investors hailed the interest rate cuts , and new asset-backed securities programme , announced by the ecb today ( if you missed it , there 's a summary here ) .
european stock markets , closing prices .
reuters tony cross , market analyst at trustnet direct , says : the reaction in equity markets goes to show just how worryingly tethered investors remain to loose monetary policy .
the ftse 100 was dragged back by bp , which shed almost 6 % in its biggest one-day fall in four years after a us court ruled it was grossly negligent over the 2010 gulf of mexico disaster .
katie martin ( @ katie martin fx ) shut the front door .
no way .
> > bundesbank president weidmann opposed ecb stimulus moves thursday : source [ wsj ]

documents.title: imf backs ecb over today 's measures
text: mario draghi has received a strong vote of support from christine lagarde , managing director of the international monetary fund ( imf ) .

in a statement , lagarde made it clear that she backs today 's decisions , saying : we strongly welcome the measures taken by the ecb , which will help to counteract the dangers posed by an extended period of low inflation . ''
the imf has been pushing the ecb for month to do more to help the eurozone economy ; in june , it recommended considering a broad-based asset purchase scheme .
laura kuenssberg ( @ bbclaurak ) if you 'd had any doubts that eurozone crisis still with us , rates cut to extraordinary low of 0.05 % , illustration of how grim things are
marc ostwald of adm investor services says that the european central bank is clearly focusing on ( the lack of ) growth , rather than simply price stability .
he writes : the key point is that the ecb is in effect implementing policy on the basis of the gdp and unemployment outlook - not inflation .
some may well observe that this is not 'not before time ' , and they are still well behind the curve .

in effect the ecb 's implicit policy parameters are much the same as the fed and the boe , even if like the boe it will attempt to frame the rationale for policy moves in terms of its inflation target .
analysts at abn amro reckon today 's measures will have positive effects '' on the eurozone economic outlook .
the package will likely put some further downward pressure on the euro , which will give an impulse to economic growth and inflation .
in addition , they will help to improve bank lending .
the tlrtos , and the abs and covered bond programmes will provide banks with lower cost funding .
the abs purchase programme could also help revive that market , which will also allow banks to remove some assets from their balance sheets .
furthermore , these measures are part of a more comprehensive package of measures .
the aqr and stress tests should increase the transparency of bank balance sheets and lead to re-capitalisation where necessary .
given that our central scenario is broadly in line with the ecb 's , we do not expect additional measures over and above the ones announced today .
that did n't take long - the newswires have established that bundesbank chief jens weidmann opposed today 's ecb decisions .
michael hewson ( @ mhewson cmc ) weidmann said to oppose ecb policy plan from rate cuts to abs - not a surprise
the institute of directors , which represents britain 's top bosses , wants eurozone leaders to heed mario draghi 's call for structural reforms .
chief economist james sproule says : what 's really needed here is action by individual governments rather than abdicating responsibility for domestic woes to the ecb .
the eurozone economies face a number of significant challenges , from insufficient flexibility in their labour markets to heavy-handed regulations stifling entrepreneurialism .
long-term liberalisation is the key to putting the eurozone back on the path to stability and growth , not short term monetary policy tools . ''

the ecb has finally sat up and paid attention '' to the sluggish eurozone recovery and the rising disinflationary pressures , says brenda kelly of ig : she adds that qe may be off the table for a while : the ecb has essentially manifested its commitment to its goals when it drove the overnight deposit rate deeper into negative territory , now charging banks 0.2 % to leave funds with it - and cut its marginal lending facility - or emergency borrowing rate - to 0.3 % .
the governing council agreed to use all unconventional measures at its disposal to hit its mandate - stable inflation at 2 % .

while this might suggest that a quantitative easing programme is still possible , the decline in the euro and the diverging policies of western central banks would indicate extraordinary stimulus of this nature will be kicked into the long grass for now .
back to today 's european central bank decisions .
aberdeen asset management investment manager luke bartholomew comments : for years the ecb has been very slow to react and often frustrated markets .
but in the face of dire and clearly worsening economic indicators draghi has actually gone beyond markets ' expectations today .
the frustration is that it has taken so long with inflation having already fallen so low , but it is certainly progress .
despite the fact that today 's announcement was not unanimous , resistance to draghi within the council is clearly receding as the european recovery wilts .
purchasing asset backed securities and covered bonds could have a significant effect but no one really knows if there 's enough of these assets to buy in order to have the desired effect .
the measures are effectively qe-lite and draghi 's left the door open for more measures in the future .

his promise that today 's cut in the deposit rates is the last is rather undermined by the fact that he made this same promise after the last cut , but he has to say this to encourage banks to take up his long term refinancing programme .
of course what he would really like is a much weaker euro , but the gentlemanly code of central banking means he ca n't come out and say this explicitly . ''

documents.title: bp shares fall 5 % after court ruling
text: breaking away from the ecb briefly shares in bp have slid by almost 5 % after a us court ruled that the 2010 deepwater horizon disaster was due to the oil giant 's gross negligence and wilful misconduct '' .
jamie mcgeever ( @ reutersjamie ) bp shares -4.7 % , biggest fall in 3 years .

judge says 2010 oil spill result of gross negligence + willful misconduct judge barbier has assigned two-thirds responsibility for the oil spill to bp , which operated the oil rig which caught fire and sank four years ago .
transocean , which owned the rig , was 30 % to blame , with us contractor halliburton , who handled the cementing of the rig , just 3 % responsible , barbier concluded .

one of the brightest analysts on the eurozone economy and the ecb , lorcan roche kelly of agenda research , is encouraged by the splits that opened up at the governing council today : joseph cotterill ( @ jsphctrl ) `` if someone is dissenting , it is almost always a good sign '' policies will work - @ twitterid trolls the bundesbank in latest note on ecb

documents.title: ecb decision day : expert reaction starts here
text: i 'm going to wrap up the best reaction to today 's european central bank news now .

first up , gary jenkins of lng capital , who reckons the chances of a quantitative easing programme have diminished : mr draghi was aggressively dovish early on , saying that the 'governing council is unanimous in its commitment to using additional unconventional instruments ' in other words , we have qe and we are prepared to use it .
but later on mr draghi admitted that today 's decisions were not unanimous .
the market may take the latter comment and decide that if mr draghi can not get agreement on a very well flagged abs program , will he be able to deliver on qe ?

documents.title: ecb press conference , what we learned
text: mario draghi rarely disappoints , and today 's press conference is another reminder that the eurozone , for all its problems , does have a top-class central banker at the helm .
full highlights start here .

but for new readers , here 's a quick reminder of the key points : 1 ) the european central bank has cut interest rates to fresh record lows in an attempt to stimulate inflation , and announced a new credit scheme to encourage lending and pump money into the eurozone banking sector .
mario draghi announced that the governing council will launch an 'asset-backed securities ' programme , buying up financial assets from banks and other investors .
the abs scheme will allow banks to sell bundles of assets , such as loans to companies and mortgages , to the ecb .
full details are n't available , but it is likely to see the ecb commit hundreds of billions of euros .
it 's not a full-blown quantitative easing programme , but it 's another step along the road .
the idea is that banks will be more willing to make loans to the real economy if they can then package the debt into new securities and sell them to the ecb .
frederik ducrozet ( @ fwred ) yes and no rt @ twitterid so : is ecb doing qe or not ?
frederik ducrozet ( @ fwred ) if you call abs and covered bonds purchases 'pure qe ' , then the ecb already did qe , in 2009-2012 .
2 ) borrowing costs are at new record lows , and draghi admitted that the ecb is now at the 'lower bound ' of interest rates .
today 's interest rate cute mean that the main refinancing rate is now just 0.05 % , from 0.15 % .
the ecb also pushed the financial sector deeper into negative territory .
it will now charge banks 0.2 % to deposit cash overnight .
pedro da costa ( @ pdacosta ) still draghi 's preferred tool 3 ) today 's decisions were not unanimous .
draghi admitted that some members of the governing council wanted to do more today , while others favoured less .
there was a comfortable majority '' in favour of today 's decisions , he said .
but that lack of unanimity hints at a full-blooded exchange of views in frankfurt today .
4 ) the ecb has cut its forecasts , conceding that the economy is weaker than expected three months ago .
it now expects inflation of just 0.6 % , from 0.7 % in june .
and it also sees gdp of just 0.9 % , down from 1.0 % before .
ed conway ( @ edconwaysky ) heading towards deflation the chart that helps explain why the ecb took action today 5 ) the ecb still wants eurozone governments to reform .
during his statement , draghi pointed out bluntly that while some governments have made significant structural progress , others have not yet legislated or implemented such work .
he did n't name names , but i 'd put spain in the former category , and both france and italy in the latter .
draghi said that reforms : now clearly need to gain momentum to achieve higher sustainable growth and employment in the euro area .
determined structural reforms in product and labour markets as well as action to improve the business environment are warranted .
and he also repeated several times that there was no secret pact that the ecb would ease policy in return for action by euro governments .
we must all do our own jobs , he said .
6 ) the financial markets have welcomed today 's news .
stock markets hit their highest levels in six and a half-years .
the euro has tumbled , shedding 1.5 cents against the us dollar to €1.3005 as the 'arsenal of measures ' were digested .
ransquawk ( @ ransquawk ) # ecb summary : draghi unleashes an arsenal of measures to protect the fragile recovery of the euro-area - > @ twitterid
berlaymonster ( @ berlaymonster ) `` they do n't seem to be very happy '' draghi says off-mic after press conference
it 's the final question of a lively , and frankly complicated press conference - is the ecb worried that inflation expectations are 'decoupling ' ?
ie , losing faith in the ecb 's ability to get inflation close to 2 % , from 0.3 % , in the medium term .
peter spiegel ( @ spiegelpeter ) reporter asks # draghi about `` risks of de-anchoring expectations '' .
i assumed that was a made-up phrase , but draghi says he asked that himself mario draghi winds up by insisting that the ecb does not expect full-blown deflation .
there would be no value in misleading people , he insists .

he concedes that forecasting errors have been made -mainly on food and energy prices , but recently on other factors , the amount of slack in the economy , and the ( stubbornly high ) unemployment rate .
and the ecb chief points out that some of those changes are outside the central bank 's role .
end of press conference .
summary and reaction to follow
lorcan roche kelly ( @ lorcanrk ) draghi should probably stop talking now
mario draghi has repeated that there is no hidden deal between eurozone governments and the ecb .
reminder - full coverage of the ecb press conference starts here .
and details of today 's eurozone interest rate cuts are here .
how can you say that the governing council is 'unanimous ' in its determination to use all measures , and then be split over today 's decisions ?
unanimity is not a blank cheque .
we are united in our resolve , but there could be differences of views when the time comes to decide what measures to undertake , draghi replies .
simon nixon ( @ simon nixon ) # draghi says he does n't want countries to lose sovereignty over structural reform but to share it > try that on rome taxi drivers !
are inflation expectations still anchored ?
yes , but the downside risk has increased , thus today 's measures .
frederik ducrozet ( @ fwred ) draghi : `` inflation expectations are still anchored , but risks have increased '' .
# nuffsaid
draghi declined to say what he discussed with italian prime minister matteo renzi .
the discussion remains private .
and he also explains that eurozone members should share fiscal responsibilities , rather than surrender them , just as they have with monetary policy .
a question from the eurozone 's next member , lithuania .
how will the lithuanian inflation rate differ from the eurozone average in the months ahead ?
draghi elegantly avoids giving an answer , but pays tribute to the remarkable progress achieved by lithuania in qualifying to join the euro .
something i missed earlier , is that draghi has flagged up the idea of expanding the ecb 's balance sheet back to its 2012 levels .
that balance sheet has been shrinking over the last two years , by around €1 trillion .
lorcan roche kelly ( @ lorcanrk ) draghi just said he wants to return ecb balance sheet to 2012 size .
that is an increase of €1 trillion !
the tltro loan programme could be up to €700bn , suggesting that the abs programme agreed today will be at least €300bn ( and could hit €500bn if the tltro total is lower ) .
peter spiegel ( @ spiegelpeter ) # draghi says it 's clear there 's a will to reform in # france .
not sure which france he was visiting .
duncan weldon ( @ duncanweldon ) ingredients of european 'abenomics ' all laid out - ecb easing , structural reform & easing of austerity .
but can a deal be struck ?
there 's no grand bargain in the eurozone between politicians and central bankers , draghi insists .
we just need to all keep doing our own jobs .
ecb ( @ ecb ) draghi : structural reforms , fiscal policy and monetary policy can jointly support growth
draghi harks back to his speech at jackson hole ( the gathering of top us central bankers ) last month .

he explains that it is crucial to keep reforming the eurozone to make it more competitive - from a confidence point of view it would be better to have very serious discussion about structural reforms first , before asking whether euro governments should be granted more flexibility .
simon nixon ( @ simon nixon ) draghi says actions justified because of falling inflation expectations and worsening m-term outlook ( even if no sign in staff forecast )
university of bristol economist tony yates reckons the abs could actually be more powerful than a quantitative easing programme .
tony yates ( @ t0nyyates ) pound for pound , you 'd expect abs purchases to be more stimulatory than qe .
but there are n't so many pounds of them .
the new abs programme we agreed today will buy up loans made to the real economy , draghi explains .

that includes residential mortgage-backed securities ( ie , home loans packed together into a new financial instrument ) tony yates ( @ t0nyyates ) pound for pound , you 'd expect abs purchases to be more stimulatory than qe .
but there are n't so many pounds of them .
today 's measures will strengthen the tltro programme we announced in june , draghi says .
( tltro is the offer of cheap long-term loans to ecb banks ) .
banks now know that there is no point holding back from signing up to the tltro in case interest rates are cut in future , as they simply ca n't be cut again .
steve collins ( @ tradedesk steve ) ez : now are at the lower band ( got it ? )
world first ( @ world first ) so rates can only now go higher in the ez
mario draghi explains that the ecb acted after seeing inflation expectations worsen in august .
draghi added that there 's nothing untoward about the appointment of us financial firm blackrock to help with an asset-backed securities programme .
ecb ( @ ecb ) draghi : rules have been followed when hiring consultant for abs programme
the ft 's claire jones seeks more information about the split at the ecb today .
draghi replies that there was a 'comfortable majority ' in favour of launching an abs programme .
ransquawk ( @ ransquawk ) `` comfortable majority agreed with the decisions '' so does that mean the germans , dutch , austrians & finnish did n't ? !
# draghi peter spiegel ( @ spiegelpeter ) does # draghi 's claim there was `` a comfortable majority '' supporting its new asset-purchase programme mean they were all lying on a sofa ?
what 's the difference between today 's abs programme , and a full-blown quantitative easing programme ?
and how big will it be ?
mario draghi declines to give a figure right now .
and he gives a complicated answer explaining why this is n't qe .
it all comes down to the 'modalities ' , which wo n't be announced until october .
one factor is that the ecb has been accepting asset-backed securities as collateral for lending for a decade , so it knows what it 's doing when it decides to buy them outright .
and the programme will be carefully set up to ensure that it only stimulates bank lending .
fabrizio goria ( @ fgoria ) draghi : definition of qe not related to size , but modalities - mni
ecb ( @ ecb ) draghi : some governors were in favour of doing more , some were in favour of doing less

documents.title: draghi : ecb discussed qe . some council members wanted more action
text: was quantitative easing discussed at today 's meeting ?
yes , draghi replies .
some were in favour of doing more , and some were in favour of less .
so today 's decisions strike a middle-ground , he explains .
a broad asset purchase scheme was discussed , and some central bank governors wanted to do more , he emphasises .
megan murphy ( @ meganmurp ) draghi : some members in favour of doing more , some in favour of doing less

documents.title: draghi : today 's decisions were not unanimous
text: onto questions .
were today 's decisions to cut interest rates and announce an asset-backed securities programme unanimous ?
no , they were not , draghi replies .
at a guess , germany 's jens weidmann must have dissented , but been outvoted .
draghi also suggests that today 's rate cuts really are the last ones .
james mackintosh ( @ jmackin2 ) draghi : this really is the last rate cut , honest .
draghi 's full statement is online here .
ecb ( @ ecb ) introductory statement mario draghi to the press conference
michael hewson ( @ mhewson cmc ) draghi says countries should n't unravel progress made already
mario draghi is ending his statement with a warning to eurozone countries to press on with structural reforms .
some countries have made important progress , but others still need to legislate and implement measures , he says .

the euro has fallen further , after mario draghi announced that the ecb will begin an asset-backed securities programme ( basically , buying bundles of loans from the banks , in an attempt to get them to do more lending ) .
it is hovering around $ 1.301 , a drop of 1 % or almost 1.5 cents.. tv
the ecb has also cut its inflation forecast for this year .
2014 : down to 0.6 % , from 0.7 % in june 2015 : unchanged at 1.1 % 2016 : unchanged at 1.4 % this cut is mainly due to lower energy costs , draghi says .
the governing council will closely monitor all risks to price stability .

documents.title: ecb cuts growth forecasts
text: the ecb has cut its growth forecasts for this year , and next year .
it now expects eurozone growth of just 0.9 % this year , down from 1 % .
the 2015 forecast has been cut to 1.6 % , from 1.7 % .
the 2016 forecasts has been raised to 1.9 % , from 1.8 % .
draghi says several factors , including high unemployment , negative loan growth and balance sheet adjustments , will dampen the eurozone recovery .
draghi says that the governing council agreed to use all unconventional measures at its disposal , if needed , to hit its mandate .
that suggests that a quantitative easing programme is still possible , but not today chris adams ( @ chrisadamsmkts ) no qe

documents.title: draghi : ecb has agreed to buy asset-backed securities
text: and we 're off .
mario draghi starts explains that the governing council agreed to cut its three main interest rates at today 's meeting ( as announced earlier ) .
he says that the ecb governing council has also agreed to start buying non-financial assets through an asset-backed security programme .
it will also include the purchase of covered bonds , as reuters reported earlier today .
we 'll get the details of this plan next month , after the october meeting .
the plan will add to the range of monetary policy measures taken in recent months , draghi says .
and it will support our forward guidance on interest rates .
it will also address the fact that the major world economies are at different stages of the economic cycle , he adds .
shaun richards ( @ notayesmansecon ) # draghi the # ecb will start to buy asset backed securities ( abs )

documents.title: watch the ecb press conference
text: mario draghi 's press conference will be streamed live here ( right-click to open in a new browser tab ) .
i 'll cover the key points and instant reaction here .

documents.title: ecb rate cut recap
text: if you 're just joining us , here 's a quick catch-up , before the ecb press conference : the european central bank has just cut interest rates to fresh record lows , and hit banks with deeper negative interests , at its monthly meeting .
in a surprise move , the ecb 's governing council cut borrowing costs in the single currency area , in response to the latest weak inflation and low growth .
the headline rate is now just 0.05 % , from 0.15 % .
and banks will be charged 0.2 % to leave money at the ecb rather than lending it to consumers and businesses .
analysts say the cut shows the depth of the ecb 's concern about deflation , and the recent poor economic data .
the news sent the euro sliding to its lowest level in over a year , down almost 1 % to $ 1.3031 .
there are also rumours that the ecb considered a new €500bn programme to stimulate bank lending - nothing official yet , but mario draghi could drop hints ( or more ) in a few minutes
just 15 minute until the european central bank holds its press conference to explain today 's decisions .
the big , big question is whether mario draghi announces new non-conventional measures in the press conference , or even hints at them ed conway ( @ edconwaysky ) ecb rate cut a genuine surprise .
but unlikely to make much difference on its own .
real question is whether ecb does qe as well todd buell ( @ toddbuell ) big ecb question is : was the rate cut the only thing the council could agree on ?
will abs buy or even qe come as well ?
we 'll see soon .

the interest rate cuts show just how worried the ecb is about very low and still falling eurozone consumer price inflation , weakening inflation expectations and faltering eurozone economic activity '' , says howard archer of ihs global insight .
carsten brzeski of ing suggests mario draghi may , finally , be preparing to flood the eurozone with cheap cash : was this the start of draghi 's helicopter ?
the ecb just announced a rate cut by 10bp , lowering the refi rate to 0.05 % , from 0.15 % .
both the marginal lending rate and the deposit rate were also cut by 10bp .
at 2.30 pm cet , we will know whether this was the prelude to another monetary policy fireworks or just the easiest way out to prevent qe without a loss of face .
european stock markets have rallied after the ecb cut interest rates .
france 's cac index surged 1 % , on optimism that the move could help europe out of its malaise .
the italian ftse mib is up by 1.5 % .. reuters

documents.title: larry elliott : another great call by mario draghi
text: today 's interest rate cut is a smart move by the european central bank , says our economics editor larry elliott .
he explains that the ecb wants to drive the euro down , and has timed the rate cut very well as the us dollar is strong at present .
it 's also a resounding statement of intent , that the ecb is not going to sit on its hands as the eurozone slides towards deflation .
linda yueh ( @ lindayueh ) rt @ twitterid : think its safe to say , # ecb suprised the markets on this one as eur/usd falls sharply

documents.title: ecb statement :
text: here 's the full statement from the ecb , announcing its decision to cut interest rates .

4 september 2014 - monetary policy decisions at today 's meeting the governing council of the ecb took the following monetary policy decisions : the interest rate on the main refinancing operations of the eurosystem will be decreased by 10 basis points to 0.05 % , starting from the operation to be settled on 10 september 2014 .
the interest rate on the marginal lending facility will be decreased by 10 basis points to 0.30 % , with effect from 10 september 2014 .
the interest rate on the deposit facility will be decreased by 10 basis points to -0.20 % , with effect from 10 september 2014 .
the president of the ecb will comment on the considerations underlying these decisions at a press conference starting at 2.30 p.m. cet today .
< end > so , no mention of new measures such as the €500bn abs programme which was rumoured to be under consideration ( new readers should click here ) .

but mario draghi may be saving new measures back for his press conference in 30 minutes lorcan roche kelly ( @ lorcanrk ) press release says nothing about further measures , so this may be all we are getting today @ twitterid
joseph weisenthal ( @ thestalwart ) try to spot when the ecb cut rates .

documents.title: euro tumbles after ecb rate cut
text: the euro has tumbled by over a cent against the us dollar to a new one-year low , as traders react to the unexpected cut in interest rates .
it has hit €1.3048 , a fall of 0.8 % , to the lowest rate in over a year .
yiannis mouzakis ( @ yiannismouzakis ) # euro -0.86 %

documents.title: ecb cuts interest rates
text: breaking : the european central bank has cut interest rates across the eurozone .
weak growth and falling inflation has prompted the ecb to ease policy again , at today 's meeting in brussels .
the headline interest rate has been slashed to just 0.05 % , from 0.15 % before .
and banks are being hit with more costly negative interest rates - they 'll be charged 0.2 % to leave cash at the ecb .
chris adams ( @ chrisadamsmkts ) ecb cuts rate on deposit facility to -0.2 pct !
the news that the ecb is considering a €500bn programme to buy up asset-backed securities and covered bonds ( see here ) has pushed the euro down a little ( -0.15 % at $ 1.3132 ) .

the potential size of the three-year programme has surprised some economists , who point out that the total abs market is n't much larger , even if you include packages of home loans ( residential mortgage-backed securities ) .
frederik ducrozet ( @ fwred ) also , in order to get closer to such numbers ( eur500bn ) , one needs to include rmbs and retained abs , generally .
however , such a plan would be designed to stimulate the currently-moribund abs market , not simply mop up what 's available today .
turn to flows-vs-stocks in your economics textbooks lorcan roche kelly ( @ lorcanrk ) if you 're looking at the current stock of abs to work out how much the ecb could buy , you 're doing it wrong .
paul hannon ( @ paulhannon29 ) by my reckoning , boe is the 9th central bank to leave policy unchanged this week .
perhaps the ecb can make things more interesting .

documents.title: a quick recap
text: traders , analysts and economists across the city , and beyond , are scrambling for lunch before the european central bank announces its decision on monetary policy in around 15 minutes .
so here 's a quick recap .
the ecb 's governing council is reported to be considering a €500bn programme to encourage eurozone banks to make new loans , securitise them , and sell them on .
details could come at 1.30pm bst in mario draghi 's press conference .
most economists expect the ecb will resist a full-blown quantitative easing programme today although it could come early next year .
eurogroup president jeroen dijsselbloem has warned that the eurozone recovery remains very fragile and uneven .
dijsselbloem also told meps that he believes the region will avoid deflation , and that governments must implement structural reforms .
the bank of england has left interest rates unchanged .
the uk interest rate decision has been welcomed by the british chambers of commerce , who are worried that the bank of england will start hiking too soon .
bcc chief economist david kern said : the uk recovery is on track but there are still challenges up ahead .
the eurozone , our largest export market , is stagnant and official figures show that manufacturing activity is at its lowest level since june last year .
we must act with caution and ensure the recovery is not put at risk with unnecessary interest rate increases . ''
the looming scottish independence vote probably encouraged the bank of england to sit tight at this week 's meeting .

howard archer of ihs global insight says : most mpc members would have been wary of raising interest rates just before the scottish independence vote due to the potential near-term negative impact that a yes vote could have on the uk economy through increasing uncertainty .
indeed , if the scots do vote for independence , it could well markedly delay any interest rate hike .
shaun richards ( @ notayesmansecon ) the bank of england will however reinvest a total of £ 14.4 billion in its # qe programme due to a maturing gilt .
# boe
any excuse to mention clement attlee : ed conway ( @ edconwaysky ) the @ twitterid leaves rates on hold for 66th meeting in row .
longest period unchanged since clement attlee was pm

documents.title: bank of england leaves interest rates and qe unchanged
text: to no-one 's surprise , the bank of england has left uk interest rates unchanged at 0.5 % , and also maintained its qe programme at £ 375bn .
we now have to wait two weeks for the minutes of today 's meeting , to find how many mpc members wanted a rate rise ( it split 7-2 last month ) .

documents.title: reports : ecb considering €500bn abs/covered bond programme
text: reuters has just reported that the european central bank 's governing council is considering throwing up to €500bn behind an asset-backed securities programme .
it could be announced today , unless there is opposition from members of the council .
the ecb has declined to comment .

here 's reuters ' first take : plans to launch an asset-backed securities ( abs ) and covered bond purchase programme worth up to 500 billion euros are on the table at thursday 's european central bank policy meeting , people familiar with the discussions say .
ecb president mario draghi will likely announce such a programme at his news conference unless it comes up against strong opposition at the governing council 's policy meeting .
the programme would have a duration of three years and comprise both abs and covered bond purchases .
the ecb could begin buying the assets this year , the people familiar with the discussions told reuters.the ecb declined to comment .
it 's not a shock that the ecb is considering an abs programme , of course .
but the size of the programme is new .
and if it does n't happen now , we 'll know that there are divisions over the plan .
also , it 's pretty rare to get a central bank leak during the meeting frederik ducrozet ( @ fwred ) very unusual kind of ecb leak .
timing at least looks odd .
frederik ducrozet ( @ fwred ) discussing abs ?
wow , surprising .
and covered bonds ?
meh .
in the uk , car sales have risen for the 30th month running , a record , as consumers continue to splash out on new models .

a sign that consumer confidence remains solid , and is underpinning the recovery ( there ' s also speculation that ppi mis-selling payouts has been pushing demand ) more here : uk drivers splash out on new cars as record run of sales continues
world first ( @ world first ) 15 minutes until the bank of england decision and traders are frothing at the mouth in anticipation
very droll , sir pedro da costa ( @ pdacosta ) the question is : will draghi flex his abs ?
for new readers , abs = asset backed securities .
mario draghi may pre-announce details of an abs programme to encourage banks to package together , or securitise , loans into a new debt instrument to sell to the ecb .
securitisation , of course , was one cause of the 2008 financial crisis , after banks bundling some pretty dubious home loans together and selling them on .
jeff black ( @ jeffrey black ) governing council lunch menu today .
sausages full of derivatives , perhaps ?
jeroen dijsselbloem went on to tell meps that he does n't believe the eurozone will slip into deflation , despite the cpi measure of inflation hitting a five-year low of just 0.3 % .
he said : i do n't actually see deflationary risks , but i see a risk of a long term of a very low inflation which has to be broken through . ''
eu parliament photo ( @ europarl photo ) # ephoto : economic dialogue w/ # eurogroup pres .
@ twitterid dijsselbloem @ twitterid economics @ twitterid en

documents.title: eurogroup chief issues warning over eurozone recovery
text: the eurozone recovery is very uneven and fragile , but the european central bank should resist launching new measures today .
that 's the message from the head of the eurogroup of eurozone finance ministers , jeroen dijsselbloem .
testifying in brussels this morning , dijsselbloem said that governments must implement structural reforms , rather than simply rely on easy monetary policy .
he also argued that the european central bank should n't launch a quantitative easing programme now , as we do n't know whether its existing measures will work .

dijsselbloem , who is also the dutch finance minister , told the european parliament 's economic and monetary committee that : recent economic data confirm that the recovery in the euro zone remains very fragile and uneven .
i believe that recent developments underscore the need to push forwards the growth and reform agenda .

fundamental challenges faced by the euro zone are unchanged , dijsselbloem 's appearance comes as the ecb governing council ponders whether to make new measures to help the eurozone ( see opening post ) .
the eurogroup head reckons we wo n't know until early 2015 whether ecb measures announced three months ago - such as the tltro offer of cheap loans to banks - are working .
he says : the june package has not been given enough consideration in our analysis and the results of that june package through the tltro has yet to actually take place , '' .

whether the ecb needs to do more will be up to their [ the ecb 's ] judgment in the next few months , but i think we also have to realize in june a number of additional measures were taken by the ecb and their effect does n't materialize within a day or a week .
it takes time . ''

econ committee press ( @ ep economics ) # eurogroup president : not everything in monetary policy , flexible fiscal policy and reforms important , stong euro effect weakens econ committee press ( @ ep economics ) # eurogroup president : flexible policy mix , investment agenda , sensible monetary policies create strong economy to fight poverty
and this handy chart shows how the ecb 's june inflation forecasts failed to predict the recent slide in annual price growth , to just 0.3 % last month .
daiwa europe ( @ daiwaeurope ) updated # ecb forecasts should illustrate need for further action to boost euro area inflation outlook .
carsten brzeski ( @ carstenbrzeski ) is mario draghi the markets ' puppeteer or string puppet ?
three more hours to wait
ed conway ( @ edconwaysky ) today is mario draghi 's day of action .
or as it 's also known : talk .
you can catch the ecb presser from 14:30 cet here

documents.title: spanish borrowing costs hit record low
text: spanish borrowing costs have hit new all-time lows at a debt auction this morning , as anticipation of an ecb qe programme drives demand for sovereign debt .
spain had no trouble raising €3bn , with investors accepting lower rates of return than ever before .
it sold €2.3bn of 10-year bonds at average yields of just 2.27 % , down from 2.68 % last time .
and the yield on €700m of 30-year bonds fell to 3.59 % , from 4.03 % .

that highlights the low inflation expectations for the euro area , as well as the prospect of the ecb easing policy further simon nixon ( @ simon nixon ) blessed are the money-printers rt @ twitterid yield at spain 's 30-year bond auction tumbles to 3.594 % from 4.043 % at last auction in july
as well as celebrating his promotion , richard pennycook can also be cheered that co-op is back in the black .
it made a pre-tax profit of £ 19m , not immense , but a damn sight better than the £ 843m loss a year ago after its banking problems came to light .
the supermarkets and funerals business generated most of the profits : co-operative group interim results for the 26 weeks ended 5 july 2014 -operative group
the co-op has also reported that underlying profits have slumped by 43 % in the first half of the year , to just £ 66m , as the crisis at its bank arm rocked the group .

documents.title: richard pennycook named as co-op group ceo
text: just in .
britain 's co-operative group has just announced that it has appointed a new ceo to steer the organisation out of its current troubles .
they 've named richard pennycook , who 's actually been working as interim ceo since march .
he joined the group as finance director in july 2013 , so he 's not a complete break from the past .
ursula lidbetter , chair , insists he 's the right man - just days after members agreed a major shake-up of how the co-op runs .

lidbetter said : the co-operative group needs strong , talented , committed leadership as it starts on the next phase of its recovery and i am delighted that richard has accepted the role of group chief executive .
last week we secured the overwhelming approval of our members for far-reaching governance reform .
we are now moving forward with the work to bring to life the new structure .

pennycook warns that we have much to do to return the group to full financial health and improve the performance of our businesses , '' but adds that co-op still has a bright and exciting '' time ahead .
he was made interim ceo in march after euan sutherland dramatically quit , saying the group was ungovernable mark broad ( @ markabroad ) richard pennycook appointed ceo of coop .
said in april : ''i have said very clearly that i do not intend to take the ceo job permanently ''

documents.title: allianz : do n't do it , mario
text: it could be disastrous if the european central bank launched a quantitative easing programme , says michael heise , chief economist of german insurance group allianz .
writing in the ft , heise warns that qe would expose taxpapers to risks , and would n't encourage borrowing as many households are already heavily indebted .
more cheap money would also deter banks from fixing their balance sheets , he argues .

- which looks unlikely , given the recovery in sovereign bond prices over the last two years heise also points out that the weak inflation is partly due to lower energy prices - qe wo n't solve that .

here 's his conclusion : monetary policy alone can not and will not return the eurozone to sustainable growth , as mario draghi , the ecb president , pointed out at the jackson hole gathering of central bankers last month .

improvements in labour markets and the investment climate , sustainable fiscal reforms and a shift of public spending towards growth-boosting investments in infrastructure and education are what europe must focus on now .
quantitative easing would sow the seeds of crisis not recovery
aurelija augulyte of nordea markets flags up that market expectations for inflation have risen a little since mario draghi pledged to use all available '' powers to ward off deflation .
this graph shows that investors still expect eurozone prices to lag those in the us and uk , but are n't quite as worried about deflation .
this is the key measure which the ecb will use when assessing whether to do qe .
5y/5y inflation expectations in the euro area .
markets more in her blog : draghi 's breakfast

documents.title: standard life shares surge 10 % after canadian deal
text: in the city , shares in standard life have soared by over 10 % after it surprised the city by agreeing to sell its 180-year-old canadian business for £ 2.2bn in cash .
most of the money ( £ 1.75bn ) will be handed back to shareholders , and the clamour has driven standard life 's shares to the top of the ftse 100 leaderboard , up by 39p to 425p .
fiona walsh ( @ fionawalsh ) standard life shares jump 9 % to 422p on surprise canadian sale and £ 1.75bn shareholder windfall otherwise , as predicted , it 's quiet .
the ftse 100 is up 6 points at 6880 .

analysts at ubs also reckon mario draghi will leave quantitative easing in his toolbox today fabrizio goria ( @ fgoria ) ubs : the @ twitterid is not seen announcing qe today - an open ended commitment to target the quantity of money is not really credible

documents.title: credit agricole : draghi may hint at qe down the line
text: mario draghi may drop hints about a potential qe programme in future today , reckons credit agricole 's ecb expert , frederik ducrozet .

he predicts that the ecb could trim the cost of taking part in its new offer of cheap long-term loans to eurozone banks ( called tltro ) , and also pre-announce a plan to buy securitised debs from the banks .
frederik ducrozet ( @ fwred ) pirvate/public qe `` under consideration '' , `` close monitoring '' of infllation expectations , abs front-loaded , tltro rate cut .
# ecbguesses frederik ducrozet ( @ fwred ) ecb 's d-day .
like in disappointment day ?

he also reckons the ecb may stick to its forecast that inflation moves back towards target by 2016 , even if it is forced to downgrade its 2014 and 2015 forecasts frederik ducrozet ( @ fwred ) oh , and crucially , 2016 hicp staff projection unchanged at 1.4 % .
# ecbguesses

documents.title: german factory orders jump , in 'encouraging sign '
text: here 's a surprise .
german factory orders have jumped to their highest level in over a year , suggesting europe 's largest economy may be recovering from its weakness earlier this year .
industrial orders bounced by 4.6 % in july , compared to june , smashing expectations of a 1.5 % rise .
it was driven by strong demand from outside the euro area , particularly for capital goods ( heavy machinery ) .
some highlights : domestic orders : +1.7 % month-on-month foreign orders : +6.9 % .

eurozone orders - +1.7 % non-eurozone : +9.8 % germany 's finance ministry is upbeat , saying : after the uncertainty caused by geopolitical developments and a weaker economy in the second quarter , the strong rise in orders is an encouraging signal for the industrial economy . ''
we need to be cautious ; orders over the may-july period are still lower than in the previous three months .
holger zschaepitz ( @ schuldensuehner ) some decent numbers out of # germany : germany july factory orders up 4.6 % mom expected up 1.5 % mom .
simon nixon ( @ simon nixon ) panic over ?
rt @ twitterid : german factory orders rise 4.6 % on month ; median est .
1.5 % gain

documents.title: ecb decision and press conference dominates the day
text: european central bank ( ecb ) president mario draghi .
orlowski/reuters good morning , and welcome to our rolling coverage of the financial markets , the economy , the eurozone and business .
with growth stalling , prices heading towards deflation , and geopolitical risks on the rise , this is a tricky time to be a central banker .
and today , mario draghi and the rest of the european central bank 's governing council must decide whether to take fresh action to aid the eurozone .
they 're meeting in frankfurt this morning to set monetary policy across the region .
we get their decision at 12.45pm bst , followed by the big event of the day ( if not the week ) , draghi 's press conference at 1.30pm bst .
it 's the first ecb meeting since draghi dramatically pledged to use all available instruments needed to ensure price stability '' .

the latest slump in inflation , to just 0.3 % in august , means this could be the day when the ecb takes the historic decision to launch a huge quantitative easing programme ( buying government bonds on a major scale ) .
but it almost certainly wo n't be .
qe may be coming soon , but it 's more likely that today draghi will talk up another weapon in the ecb 's armoury .
many economists believe he 'll pre-announce a plan to buy asset-backed securities ( abss ) from eurozone banks .
an abs programme could encourage banks to agree loans with businesses , so the debt can be packaged up into a new security and sold to the ecb .
that might help .

but julian jessop of capital economics reckons the ecb must launch qe eventually it has also been our long-held view that the ecb will eventually be forced to adopt full-blown quantitative easing ( qe ) , involving large-scale outright purchases of government bonds .
and the latest activity and price data , including evidence on inflation expectations , have surely brought the timing of that announcement forward .
with interest rates so low , a further cut in borrowing costs is unlikely , but not impossible .
the ecb will also update its economic forecasts ; its staff are likely to have taken the red pen to june 's projections , given the weak inflation and gdp figures since .
it 's also bank of england decision day .
we 're not expecting a change in interest rates , even though the monetary policy committee split 7-2 last month .
but with the services sector growing strongly last month , and construction firms struggling to find skilled staff , there 's lots for the boe to ponder .
their decision comes at noon bst..
the stock markets look calm this morning , after the ftse 100 hit a new 14 year high yesterday .
also coming up 9am : the uk car registrations figures , for august .
1.15pm bst : the monthly measure of us private sector employment , which will give clues to tomorrow 's non-farm payroll .

bulletin.text: European Central Bank cuts interest rates to fresh record lows and announces an asset-backed securities programme to fight deflation.

Asset-backed securities scheme agreed - details next month.
ECB cuts growth and inflation forecasts.
